column4: what is the difference between the server livecd and the alternate livecd

They both use the same installer, and if you go into the advanced menus they both can install either Desktop or Server (or any other configuration). The difference is just what packages are contained on the CD itself and what is installed by default.
Yes.
Yes, Ubuntu is just a huge set of interchangeable packages. Anything is possible.
You can't fit much on a floppy.

When helping others please don't recommend editing the grub.cfg directly as most users want their changes to be persistant and are using update-grub to keep their grub.cfg up to date (the default in Ubuntu) rather than writing it manually.
ok
No.
It's the other way around, you can't have cross filesystem hardlinks.
there is a best game
Why do you want an old kernel?
for the module at http://eeepc-linux.googlecode.com
so can I get an official one or do I need to compile my own?
Why do you think that you need this particular module?
google referred me to this page https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EeePC/Using#Overclocking not the Overclocking part
any other questions or comments?
Do you have a file /proc/eee/fsb currently?
no, i dont
If you run "sudo modprobe eeepc-laptop" does it cause the file to appear?
well, the module loads fine and shows up in an lsmod, but /proc/eee/fsb is not created
would you recommend using 10.04 since I need an older kernel? Or should I compile a mainline kernel? This is for a livecd so I dont expect to do many upgrades or install lots of software.
What will this liveCD be used for? Why is overclocking so important for you?
Also, it's possible that the module will build against a modern kernel.

well I use grub2's iso boot on my eeepc to save MASSIVE disk space, I like to customize the lubuntu or xubuntu livecd's to include a few extra things, and since I can easily include overclocking support I want it. My computer's battery only lasts about 10 minutes so power usage is of no concern... Also I tried to build aginst 3.2.0-23-generic but the build fails
